name: Homewood Suites by Hilton San Diego Airport - Liberty Station

reviews.title: Wonderful stay! Highly recommend.
reviews.text: Visited San Diego (from NJ) for sister's wedding. Cannot express enough how pleased we were with our stay at Homewood Suites San Diego Airport - Liberty Station. Suite was clean and very large for a family. Complimentary breakfast and dinner buffets were terrific...tasty and very convenient, saving plenty in meal expenses. The hotel staff was friendly and very accommodating. Location was great...near airport, however, plane noise was no issue whatsoever. Had other family members staying next door at the Marriott, but after our glowing commentary about Homewood Suites, they plan to stay here next time. Will definitely be back next time we visit San Diego. Thanks for everything!

reviews.title: Great getaway
reviews.text: This hotels location is great. You can go to all parts of the city with very little travel time. We had the 2 bedroom suite. I wished they could have put 2 beds in one of the bedrooms, instead of 1 in both. This makes it a lot easier for 3 women traveling together than a rollway of sleeper sofa.(They aren't very comfortable). The breakfast was very good.

reviews.title: Wonderful choice for a family
reviews.text: We got off to a rocky start when we arrived around midnight after a long drive with children and our keys wouldn't work and we couldn't find our room. Fortunately, things got better! Our two bedroom room was wonderful. I know I always wonder what the exact layout is of these rooms. The entrance was to a living room/kitchen. One bedroom was on each side of the living room, and each bedroom had a bathroom. The sinks were outside the bathroom with the toilet and bathtub inside. One bedroom had a king bed and the other had a queen. Both had flat screen tvs, and so did the living room. Each bedroom also had a door that closed, so the living room/kitchen in the center was completely private when used as a bedroom with the pullout couch. This essentially gave us three bedrooms. The kitchen had a dishwasher, stovetop, microwave, coffee maker, and fullsize fridge (no oven). It was very well stocked with utensils, etc

reviews.title: beautiful neighborhood, convenient location
reviews.text: The breakfast had a good selection, and we really enjoyed getting this start to the day of sight seeing. The pool was heated, and the grandchildren loved it. We loved the hot tub! Parking was free and ample, which was a definite plus, and we were only about 15 minutes from the zoo and Seaworld. Best wifi connection I've ever had at a hotel! Highly recommend this place if travelling with family. We were able to comfortably house 4 adults and 2 children with a hot breakfast and free parking for an incredibly reasonable price.

reviews.title: Great location and nice rooms!
reviews.text: Even though we are San Diego locals, we love this place for a little destressing "staycation". This was our third trip to this property and this time we sprung for one of the "bay view suites". Previously we have stayed in the king one bedroom suites, which are actually nicer than the bay view suite we just tried. We had a tiny view of the bay from our bedroom window. View was not worth the many extra dollars paid. Otherwise this is a beautiful property, well maintained, with great walking paths in the immediate area, stores and restaurants within walking distance, and convenient to many sightseeing places in San Diego. Its location near the airport is great, with a free shuttle.

reviews.title: Best Hotel Stay Ever!!!
reviews.text: Clean family friendly room with a beautiful fully equipped mini kitchen. Awesome customer service. Hot daily breakfast. Sea World and the SD Zoo is within 15 mins drive. Free parking accomodation. Great location, near restaurants and stores. The place has bbq area, basketball court, gym, laundry room, spa, pool, etc. Recommended for extended stay.

reviews.title: Great location, good breakfast, and they found our lost iPod
reviews.text: This location caters to the Naval/military post nearby. It is just past the San Diego airport (toward the water side) next to a strip mall with a Starbucks, USAA ATM, Oggies Brewery, Sushi, Pizza, Mexican food, and a massage place. The USS Neversail model is also parked next to the hotel. They have a hot tub, a pool, and outdoor BBQ and fireplace areas. Million dollar bay views, a great jogging trail near the hotel, one bedroom suites, clean, quiet and comfortable.. what more could anyone ask for? Free breakfast? They have that, too. This is not, however, a budget hotel. We paid almost $200 a night for our stay. My husband also accidentally left his iPod by the pool, and it was promptly returned to us.

reviews.title: Clean, current decor, white duvet'
reviews.text: The only negitive feature with this hotel is the walls seem a little thin.

reviews.title: Fantastic value in a great location
reviews.text: We (family of 3) came to this hotel after checking out of another unsatisfactory resort, and it was such a lovely change. We had a one bedroom suite with a view on the 4th floor. Great size room, with a full kitchen (dishwasher, microwave, hotplate) and a supermarket nearby so we could stock up. It is in a complex with many restaurants and bars within walking distance and the drive to downtown and the gaslamp district is quick and pleasant (along the harbour). Comfortable beds (including the fold out sofa in the lounge room), good heating/cooling system, a desk as well as a table which I liked. Free breakfast was great, the pool was heated, the internet was fast and free and there was ample free parking. This is sort of like staying in a serviced apartment, the staff pretty much just leave you be unless you need something which is really nice. Highly recommended, we would stay here again.

reviews.title: Good Location But Staff Not Overly Accommodating
reviews.text: Made reservations several months in advance for a 2 bedroom suite. Requested a waterfront view & received an email back indicating my request was noted. Arrived early and was told to come back at 4:00pm. Arrived back at 4:00pm & asked if my suite with the waterfront view was ready. They said it was ready but it was not a waterfront view - it was a parking lot view. I said I had requested a waterfront view & they acknowledged that request was on the reservation but they could not accommodate that request. When I spoke to the assistant manager, he gave an excuse that there was no waterfront view suites available. There are three other sides to the building that would have provided a much nicer view than a parking lot, but apparently they were not interested in making my stay a bit more pleasant.
This was our 2nd visit. Still a great hotel. Internet, parking, breakfast, quiet location. We'll stay here again, and again. Our favorite place to stay in San Diego.
reviews.title: 2nd time here. Still great.

reviews.text: Great stay at Homewood Suites, San Diego in December. We stayed with our 2 children (4 & 2) and stayed in a nice size 1 king bed suite. Room was equipped with microwave, toaster, coffee machine and dishwasher. Complimentary breakfast, internet and parking made the stay perfect. A short walk down the inlet to a playground and the main liberty station shops/restaurants. Ideal for families. Didn't use the pool because it was a little cold, but it looked nice. Highly recommended
reviews.title: Highly recommended

reviews.text: I am a HH Diamond and travel frequently for business. I try to stay at Homewood properties if possible. This is clearly one of Hilton's marquee Homewood Suites. The grounds were absolutely beautiful. Almost like an arboretum. The interior was immaculate. Very spacious suites. I will stay here next time in San Diego. Outstanding!
reviews.title: One of Homewood Suites Marquee Properties

reviews.text: We stayed here for 5 nights in August 2011 to cap of our 2 week Southern California adventure. It was a good decision and I would recommend this hotel to other families who need a reasonably priced home base while exploring San Diego.
reviews.title: Would Definately Recommend

reviews.text: We chose a 2 bedroom suite in order to have a little room to spread out after 8 nights of togetherness in one hotel room. Our suite was immaculate and everything was in working order. I didn't notice any noise from other guests. Housekeeping staff was wonderful and very friendly ... I left a few dishes in the sink one morning and they were washed when I returned.
reviews.title: wonderful hotel and great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was in a great location, close to everything we wanted to see. The room was just the right size for a couple. You would need more of a separation if there were more people. The kitchen had everything we needed when we decided to eat in, but the hotel provided breakfast every morning. The best part was the waffle station. You could eat in or out on the patio. After breakfast we would go to the pool room and shoot a game or 2. We also enjoyed their free light evening meals Mon-Thurs along with all the beer, wine and lemonaid you wanted to drink. The room was always cleaned with very comfortable beds. Only one TV. We never got in the pool but the hot tub was very nice. They also had a basketball court and a gym. FREE parking!! which is rare in that area. Front desk very helpful and friendly. I would stay there again and again and again...
reviews.title: Great Experience!!

reviews.text: My family and I recently stayed at this property and were very happy with our choice. This was our first time staying at this location. Property is centrally located to attractions in the area. The room suited our needs perfectly and was comfortable to come "home" to after a long day. The breakfast was a great way to start off the day, simple yet satisfying. The property itself was clean well cared for. We did experience a bit of a problem with the hot water in the north bldg however as experienced traveler's I understand "things" happen and the hotel staff did acknowledge there was a problem. The personnel we encountered were pleasant and helped us with our questions and needs. We would return to HWS-Liberty Station if our travels bring us back to San Diego!
reviews.title: Excellent Choice

reviews.text: My husband and I came for the weekend. We are originally from San Diego so we wanted our hotel to be central. We were VERY happy with our stay. For the price ($131)it was a real value. We had a bay view, beautiful walking trails, very nice looking hotel (you could have a wedding here)tasty breakfast, and a junior suite. Liberty station is a nice little town that needs to be seen by taking a walk. There are too many hidden away places. The hotel is just off of a plaza with a few very good places to eat. The Thai & sushi places are very good. There is a free shuttle to and from the airport but I'd recommend renting a car if you want to see the rest of S.D.
reviews.title: This is the place to stay!!!

reviews.text: Stayed four nights after a similar period in Anaheim. Proved to be an excellent base from which to explore San Diego and a relaxing contrast to our Anaheim accommodations (HoJo).
reviews.title: Made life easy

reviews.text: The hotel is well located if you've got a car but wouldn't be practical without one and the 300 odd acres that comprise the Liberty Station project is a lovely mix of parks, water and developed space.
reviews.title: Very nice vacation stay for our family with small kids

aka: Homewood Suites San Diego Airport - Liberty Station Hotel San Diego
